refnamediv.refpurpose: Multiply amplitudes of a pvoc stream by those of a second pvoc stream, with dynamic scaling.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Multiply amplitudes of a pvoc stream by those of a second pvoc stream, with dynamic scaling.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: fsig pvsfilter fsigin, fsigfil, kdepth[, igain]

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: kdepth -- controls the depth of filtering of fsigin by fsigfil .
Here the input pvoc stream amplitudes are modified by the filtering stream, keeping its frequencies intact. As usual, both signals have to be in the same format.

warning.para: It is unsafe to use the same f-variable for both input and output of pvs opcodes. Using the same one might lead to undefined behavior on some opcodes. Use a different one on the left and right sides of the opcode.

refsect1.title: Examples

example.title: Example
example.programlisting:
kfreq expon 500, p3, 4000 ; 3-octave sweep kdepth linseg 1, p3/2, 0.5, p3/2, 1 ; varying filter depth
asig in ; input afil oscili 1, kfreq, 1 ; filter t-domain signal
fim pvsanal asig,1024,256,1024,0 ; pvoc analysis fil pvsanal afil,1024,256,1024,0 fou pvsfilter fim, fil, kdepth ; filter signal aout pvsynth fou ; pvoc synthesis

refsect1.para: In the example above the filter curve will depend on the spectral envelope of afil; in the simple case of a sinusoid, it will be equivalent to a narrowband band-pass filter.
